required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Apatinib as Third-line Therapy for Primary Pulmonary Lymphoepithelioid Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of Apatinib as Third-line Therapy for Primary Pulmonary Lymphoepithelioid Carcinoma

brief_summary.textblock: Currently, there is no standard treatment for primary pulmonary lymphoepithelioid carcinoma. Apatinib is a new kind of Vascular endothelial growth factor receptor-2 (VEGFR-2) tyrosine kinase inhibitors (TKIs). A disease-control rate of 75% was found in lung cancer patients in a phase II clinical study. Therefore, researchers hope to explore the efficacy and safety of apatinib in the treatment of primary pulmonary lymphoepithelioid carcinoma.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study is a prospective, exploratory clinical trial. The purpose of this study was to evaluate the efficacy and safety of apatinib monotherapy in the treatment of primary pulmonary lymphoepithelioid carcinoma.
Thirty-three cases of pulmonary lymphoepithelioid carcinoma were enrolled in this study.
The primary endpoint was median progression-free survival.

arm_group.description: apatinib, 500 mg, po, QD; 28 days every cycle
